item.title: Blind Guardian in Berlin
item.description: my first concert after(!) the seemingly endless pandemic. and it was as expected: very good atmosphere in a very good location with very good sound a very good band from krefeld downtown.
item.content:
my first concert after(!) the seemingly endless pandemic. and it was as expected: very good atmosphere in a very good location with very good sound a very good band from krefeld downtown.

how can you describe this band? i think, as a very good long player, as a well aged whiskey. this evening, blind guardian was in excellent playing mood. the guardian’s celebrated the 30th anniversary of the album “Somewhere Far Beyond” and other classics from the band’s history. what a wounderful concert on sunday night, love this metal genre too!

item.title: Recycled Laptop Usb Camera
item.description: for a little side project, i needed small usb cams, preferably for free. i still had old hp elitebooks 8440p, and from their display, i removed the camera, see the picture below. the picture shows always the pinout.
item.content:
for a little side project, i needed small usb cams, preferably for free. i still had old hp elitebooks 8440p, and from their display, i removed the camera, see the picture below. the picture shows always the pinout.

next, i soldered the 4 cables together, leaving the GPIO pin unused. no big deal, there is no faster way to get an usb-cam for raspberry and co.

Pin Name Wire color Description
1 V(Bus) Red +5 V
2 D- White Data-
3 D+ Green Data+
4 GND Black Ground

item.title: 36c3 Resource Exhaustion
item.description: for the third time in a row the hacker community met for the 36c3 in leipzig. 4 days between christmas and new year, 4 days with and in a unique community.
item.content:
for the third time in a row the hacker community met for the 36c3 in leipzig. 4 days between christmas and new year, 4 days with and in a unique community.

lots of inspiration, lots of good talks, lots of hardware and software hacking. we had a lot of fun again.

item.content:
climate-neutrally I biked this year to the chaos communication camp 2019.

I didn’t notice that much, but the atmosphere was great.

item.title: 35c3 refreshing memories
item.description: for the second time, the messe (fair) leipzig was the the place to be for all hackers at the end of year 2018. fun, fun and spass am geraet.
item.content: for the second time, the messe (fair) leipzig was the the place to be for all hackers at the end of year 2018. fun, fun and spass am geraet.

item.title: 34c3 tuwat
item.description:
first things first. i have my lost laptop again - thank you, thank you Deutsche Bahn!

for the first time the messe (fair) leipzig was the new location for the nerds from all parts of the world.
item.content:
first things first. i have my lost laptop again - thank you, thank you Deutsche Bahn!

for the first time the messe (fair) leipzig was the new location for the nerds from all parts of the world.

the size of the halls was impressive and offered space for all high and low tech, for art and design and of course all sorts of light and sound installations. we had a lot of fun again (am Gerät).

item.title: 33c3 Work For Me
trash metal, yeah
item.description: one of the best trash metal bands worldwide has the house rocked here in berlin, germany on 22th june 2016.
item.content:
one of the best trash metal bands worldwide has the house rocked here in berlin, germany on 22th june 2016.

megadeth with frontman dave mustaine have played new songs from the new released album Dystopia and fired up classic songs as well. love this metal genre!

item.title: slack openweather bot
item.description: all the cool kids are working with which messaging app? - slack of course! from my point of view, the slack integrations is the best feature of that app, and my favorite integration are the incoming webhooks. all what you need is to define a channel to post in and copy the webhook url where you post your payload json staff. above a litte python example that request weather data from openweathermap and post it to my channel #general.
item.content: all the cool kids are working with which messaging app? - slack of course! from my point of view, the slack integrations is the best feature of that app, and my favorite integration are the incoming webhooks. all what you need is to define a channel to post in and copy the webhook url where you post your payload json staff. above a litte python example that request weather data from openweathermap and post it to my channel #general. configure a cron job on your machine and the weatherbot is ready to post weather data to a specified slack channel.

item.title: django 1.7 update django database to reflect changes in existing models
item.description: 1 2 python manage.py makemigrations app name python manage.py migrate anyway, it’s time to upgrade my projects to django 1.8. update: it’s really time … django 1.11
item.content:
1
2

python manage.py makemigrations app name
python manage.py migrate

anyway, it’s time to upgrade my projects to django 1.8.

update: it’s really time … django 1.11

item.title: django allow only requests from specific IP
item.description: for a django project i needed a exception for the rss feed requests. they are only allowed to request for a set of specific IP addresses. django’s feed syndication framework is the base, and i have added a little snippet for receiving the remote address. the HttpRequest.META method reads all available HTTP header informations and for that case we read REMOTE_ADDR. only ip addresses in ip_allow are ready to receive the feed objects.
item.content: for a django project i needed a exception for the rss feed requests. they are only allowed to request for a set of specific IP addresses. django’s feed syndication framework is the base, and i have added a little snippet for receiving the remote address. the HttpRequest.META method reads all available HTTP header informations and for that case we read REMOTE_ADDR. only ip addresses in ip_allow are ready to receive the feed objects.

item.title: 31c3 is over
item.description: the pyneo project is very happy to be part of the 31c3 in hamburg. our small team had a lot of fun with hard and software. samsung phones, a special tizen phone, gps tracker with gsm modems, bus pirates, serial consol finder workshop and so on. cool guys on a cool loacation with very interesting talks, thats the spirit during entertaining congress. i like it and i’m looking forward to the next year.
item.content: the pyneo project is very happy to be part of the 31c3 in hamburg. our small team had a lot of fun with hard and software. samsung phones, a special tizen phone, gps tracker with gsm modems, bus pirates, serial consol finder workshop and so on. cool guys on a cool loacation with very interesting talks, thats the spirit during entertaining congress. i like it and i’m looking forward to the next year. 31c3 a new dawn!

item.title: android http post to django server
item.description: for an android/server gps project, i have need to send some data to a server. in my case a django server.
item.content:
for an android/server gps project, i have need to send some data to a server. in my case a django server.

on my android app a HttpPost sends data to http://epydial.pyneo.org/receiver/. The HttpPost is embedded in a AsyncTask. After sucessfully post, a toast message is genereated.

private class PostAsyncTask extends AsyncTask {
    @Override
    protected Double doInBackground(String... params) {
        // TODO Auto-generated method stub
        postData(params[0]);
        return null;
    }

    protected void onPostExecute(Double result){
        Toast.makeText(getApplicationContext(), "successfully logged", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
    }

    @SuppressWarnings("unused")
    public void postData(String valueIWantToSend) {
        HttpClient httpclient = new DefaultHttpClient();
        HttpPost httppost = new HttpPost("http://epydial.pyneo.org/receiver/");
        try {
            // create a list to store HTTP variables and their values
            List nameValuePairs = new ArrayList();
            // add an HTTP variable and value pair
            nameValuePairs.add(new BasicNameValuePair("myHttpData", valueIWantToSend));
            httppost.setEntity(new UrlEncodedFormEntity(nameValuePairs));
            // send the variable and value, in other words post, to the URL
            HttpResponse response = httpclient.execute(httppost);
        } catch (ClientProtocolException e) {
            // process exception
        } catch (IOException e) {
            // process exception
        }
    }
}

the receiver method on my django server:

@csrf_exempt
def receiver(request):
    if request.method == 'POST':
        with open('/var/www/qblog/static/xml/test.xml', 'w') as f:
            f.write(request.POST.get('myHttpData'))
            f.close()

further information about the @csrf_exempt decorator you can find here. the rest of the receiver method is self-explanatory. all my data, in that case longitude and latitude are saved in the myHttpData array and are written to a xml file for further web processing.

item.content: this image is composed of 2 photos, and showing the gartenstrasse in northerly and southerly direction. and it is not the berlin wall.

item.title: guitar hero
item.content: zakk wylde from black label society presented new songs from the new album ‘Catacombs Of The Black Vatican’ in berlin ‘huxleys neue welt’ on july 1st. the show and the sound was impressive. the berlin chapter says thank you for a great show!

item.title: adminer - alternative to phpmyadmin
item.description: more security, more performance, better interface, which promises the database management tool adminer.
item.content:
more security, more performance, better interface, which promises the database management tool adminer.

the single php script can handle mysql, postgresql, sqlite, ms sql, mongodb and other. i have tested the functionality, and it does what it promise. a cool tool!

item.title: python and the facebook api
item.description: to run this example, you need at first a facebook app. this video shows the simple setup. pick the App ID and App Secret from there and insert it in the python code below. the program returns all comments from a single facebook post. you can limited the request and you can change the facebook post ID. the graph api explorer is the perfect starting point to learn more about the fb api.
item.content:
to run this example, you need at first a facebook app. this video shows the simple setup. pick the App ID and App Secret from there and insert it in the python code below.

the program returns all comments from a single facebook post. you can limited the request and you can change the facebook post ID. the graph api explorer is the perfect starting point to learn more about the fb api.

the last part is for error handling and simple json parsing to get all the interesting information.

item.title: a simple d-bus daemon implemented with c
item.description: first of all, you need a d-bus config file for the daemon. on a standard debian system it is saved in /etc/dbus-1/system.d/ as cneod.conf. and here you can find the daemon code. what can you do with the compiled code? with the d-bus rules above, you are able to: shutdown suspend reboot setbrightness getbrightness your system without root access. if you have a closer look to the code, you will see, the program is intended for my openmoko GTA02 and for my laptop/netbook.
item.content:
first of all, you need a d-bus config file for the daemon. on a standard debian system it is saved in /etc/dbus-1/system.d/ as cneod.conf.

and here you can find the daemon code. what can you do with the compiled code? with the d-bus rules above, you are able to:

  • shutdown
  • suspend
  • reboot
  • setbrightness
  • getbrightness

your system without root access. if you have a closer look to the code, you will see, the program is intended for my openmoko GTA02 and for my laptop/netbook. example d-bus calls and the gcc command are inline from cneod.c now its time to build your own system daemons. more about the architecture behind the d-bus concept you can find here.
